content.text:
# Your Job

Scan https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw, https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw, and https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot for new tools, skills, and architectures. Pick the best new idea and actually WRITE the code to implement it as a new PopeBot skill in your sandbox (.pi/skills/). Write and execute a test to prove it works. Use the send_email tool to email winsorllc@yahoo.com a progress report detailing what you built, how you implemented it, your test results, and code samples so the user can review it at 8 AM.

content.thinking:
I need to scan three GitHub repositories for new tools, skills, and architectures. Let me start by exploring each repository to understand what they contain and find the best ideas to implement.

Let me break this down into steps:
1. Scan the three GitHub repositories
2. Identify the best new idea
3. Implement it as a new PopeBot skill
4. Write and execute a test
5. Email a progress report

Let me start by using git to clone or at least inspect these repositories. I'll need to use bash commands to explore them.

content.text: I'll systematically scan these three repositories to discover new tools, skills, and architectures, then implement the best find. Let me start by exploring each repository.

content.thinking: The clone is in progress. Let me wait for it to complete and then clone the other repositories.
Good, now let me clone thepopebot as well to compare against the current state.
Good, all three repositories are cloned. Now let me explore their structures to find new tools, skills, and architectures.
